intro: Stopinaca parvifolia, commonly known as the small-leaved stopinaca, is a flowering plant native to specific regions of South America. It belongs to the Acanthaceae family and is characterized by its small, narrow leaves and clusters of tubular flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forest understories. Its flowers are often pink or purple and attract pollinators like bees and butterflies. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and ecologically significant species.
